subject: Medicine
title: The Nuremberg Code
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Nuremberg Code.

hook.text: Nazi doctors froze, burned, and injected prisoners in the name of science. The world responded with new rules.

buildup.text: After World War II, Nazi doctors were tried at Nuremberg for horrific experiments on camp prisoners.

discovery.text: The Nuremberg Code established that voluntary consent is absolutely essential in human experimentation.

twist.text: Despite the code, unethical experiments continued for decadesâ€”Tuskegee, radiation tests, and prison studies.

climax.text: Rules alone aren't enough. Ethics requires enforcement, accountability, and a culture that values human dignity.

punchline.text: History's darkest chapter wrote the rules of consent.

quiz.question: What key principle did the Nuremberg Code establish?
options: Voluntary consent is absolutely essential in human research
All medical experiments must produce positive results
Only military doctors can conduct research on humans
